title: Where LSU ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: Brian Kelly is out at LSU, adding to what is already a busy college football coaching carousel. Here are the jobs we think are best and why.

title: NBA memo: Must assess 'dire risks' of gambling
content: An NBA memo sent to teams said the league is reassessing its position on legal sports betting, how it should be regulated and ways to protect players from "dire risks."

title: After Kelly ouster, LSU fires top assistant Sloan
content: LSU offensive coordinator and quarterbacks coach Joe Sloan has been fired effective immediately, the school announced on Monday, just a day after firing head coach Brian Kelly.

title: Coen: Jags not trading second-year WR Thomas
content: The Jaguars are not going to trade receiver Brian Thomas Jr. despite the second-year player's struggles to start the season, head coach Liam Coen said Monday.

title: Sources: Wolves star Edwards to miss 2 weeks
content: Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards will miss two weeks with a right hamstring strain, sources told ESPN.

title: Bills fear DT Oliver has torn biceps, sources say
content: The Bills fear that standout defensive tackle Ed Oliver tore a biceps in Sunday's 40-9 victory over the Panthers and will be sidelined indefinitely, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Lockett to reunite with Carroll on Raiders
content: Veteran wide receiver Tyler Lockett, who was released by the Titans last week, is expected to sign with the Las Vegas Raiders, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: LSU fires Kelly, still finalizing his $54M buyout
content: A day after a 49-25 loss to Texas A&M in Baton Rouge, LSU fired coach Brian Kelly on Sunday night, with athletic director Scott Woodward announcing in a statement that "we had high hopes that he would lead us to multiple SEC and national championships."

title: Source: Mets hiring Snitker's son as hitting coach
content: Former Astros hitting coach Troy Snitker will be the Mets' next hitting coach, a source confirmed to ESPN, as the club continues to overhaul its coaching staff. Snitker, 36, was with the Astros for seven seasons until he was dismissed earlier this month.

title: 💰 How bettors view Monday's sports equinox
content: Mondays in October have had some of the best betting action all year, and now the NBA enters the mix.

title: Barnwell makes sense of a blowout-filled Week 8: One key takeaway from each of Sunday's 11 games
content: Ten of Sunday's games were two-score wins -- not super exciting. But we still found something fun in every matchup, including some RB takeovers.

title: Justin Fields won't get benched? Myles Garrett is DPOY? Let's overreact to Week 8
content: We sized up Week 8 overreactions, including fantasy. Is Fields on more solid ground? Will Garrett be the DPOY?

title: 'Monday Night Football' moments for all 32 NFL teams, including one we'd rather forget
content: Dazzling plays, huge comebacks and one notable injury punctuated the first 55 years of "Monday Night Football."

title: Why a team that was one win from a Super Bowl is wallowing in third place in NFC East
content: With Jayden Daniels set to miss his third game on Monday night, Washington is off to an unexpectedly slow start.

title: The 4 teams currently playing like national champions -- and why
content: After nine weeks of twists and turns, these teams are at the head of the class -- at least for the time being.

title: Much more than just Vlad and Springer: Meet the Blue Jays' under-the-radar mashers
content: Toronto is a tough out from top to bottom. Here are five guys you need to know who help lengthen the lineup.

title: Bullpen woes, L.A.'s offensive troubles, Toronto's power: What we've learned so far
content: With the World Series resuming in Los Angeles, we break down what we've seen so far -- and what to expect.

title: 'That'll change all the narratives': Trae Young knows exactly what will silence his critics
content: The Hawks had a busy offseason that included surrounding Young with star power. Can he claim the wide-open East and prove he's worth a max deal?

title: Who's got next? Predicting five breakout players for this season
content: Which NBA players are primed to take the next step in their development? Jeremy Woo predicts the top five.

title: Scenes from the ultimate FCS grudge match: North Dakota State against South Dakota State
content: The top-2 FCS teams, and winners of 12 of the past 14 national titles, met in one of the country's fiercest rivalries.

title: Real Madrid enjoy statement Clásico win; Liverpool lose again; more
content: Sunday's Clasico was a blockbuster, though Barca may regret sending Lamine Yamal out pre-game to rile up Madrid. PLUS: What Liverpool's fourth straight league loss means, drama for Inter at Napoli, and more.

title: Sports' mafia ties run deeper than NBA gambling scandal
content: Prosecutors say two former NBA players played in rigged poker games run by mob members. Organized crime has long exploited athletes' vulnerabilities.

title: World Series and MNF, plus NBA, NHL and more showdowns
content: Celebrate the sports equinox with the World Series, 'Monday Night Football,' NBA and NHL as the headliners.

title: Moultrie & Co. get Hayes' team back playing 'the USA way'
content: For a team that prides itself on playing "the USA way," Sunday's 3-1 win over Portugal was a good response to Thursday's shock loss.

title: Week 8 winners and losers: Taylor and Cook deliver; CMC and Robinson fall flat
content: Jonathan Taylor, James Cook III and Saquon Barkley led the way with big Week 8 performances, while Christian McCaffrey, Bijan Robinson and Caleb Williams were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Who got the ball, who got shut out on Sunday
content: Knowing who got the ball and how is as important as the fantasy points that were (and weren't) put up on Sunday.

title: First bets for Week 9: Colts, Cowboys, Lions cover, plus a Rookie of the Year pick
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are four early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: College football betting: How to value undefeated BYU, Georgia Tech and Navy
content: Sportsbooks are slowly taking notice of BYU, Georgia Tech and Navy, but what's the best strategy to bet them?

title: How Norris rediscovered F1 title 'favorite' tag in Mexico
content: Lando Norris hasn't been F1's title favorite for some time, but his Mexico win puts him atop the standings.

title: Byron, Larson get last spots in NASCAR title finale
content: William Byron won at Martinsville Speedway in the third-round finale of the NASCAR Cup Series playoffs, while Kyle Larson sealed the final Championship 4 spot on points.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What to make of big games from Ty Simpson, Anthony Hill Jr.
content: Could Ty Simpson be the QB1? Is Anthony Hill Jr. climbing the LB ranks again? We have notes on NFL prospects through CFB Week 9.

title: Two F's and an incomplete make for a woeful UFC 321 report card
content: Following a disappointing ending during the main event between Tom Aspinall and Ciryl Gane at UFC 321, Andreas Hale gives a letter grade for every fight on the card.

title: Pickups: Go get Egor Demin, Herbert Jones, Walter Clayton Jr.
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Why everyone is talking about Bayern's Lennart Karl
content: Bayern Munich forward Lennart Karl has caught the eye after some fine performances this season. Here's everything you need to know.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Ratcliffe blocks Man United move for Lewandowski
content: Manchester United minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe has blocked a shock move for Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Red-hot Michael Brennan wins in Utah for first tour title
content: Michael Brennan was just as dominant at Black Desert as he was on the PGA Tour Americas. He closed with a 5-under 66 to go from a sponsor exemption to a PGA Tour winner Sunday with his four-shot victory in the Bank of Utah Championship.

title: Delhi Woman's Father Detained For Making Up Acid Attack Story
content: The woman's father has now been detained by the Delhi Police for masterminding the fake acid story to frame the three men. He has confessed that he plotted the whole conspiracy, said the Delhi Police.

title: Trump Won't Meet Canada PM "For A While" As Carney Offers To Resume Talks
content: US President Donald Trump said on Monday that he would not meet with Canada "for a while," as Prime Minister Mark Carney offered an olive branch to resume trade talks.

title: US Navy Loses Fighter Jet, Helicopter In South China Sea Within 30 Minutes
content: A US fighter jet and a helicopter based off the aircraft carrier USS Nimitz both crashed into the South China Sea within 30 minutes of each other, the Navy's Pacific Fleet said.

title: President Droupadi Murmu Participates In Chhath Puja Celebrations
content: President Droupadi Murmu participated in Chhath Puja celebrations in the President's Estate, where devotees offered Arghya to the setting sun on Monday, her office said.

title: S Jaishankar, Marco Rubio Hold Talks In Malaysia Amid Tariff Tensions
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday held talks with his American counterpart Marco Rubio amid efforts by the two sides to reset bilateral ties that have come under severe strain over punitive US tariffs on Indian goods.

title: 10 Face Trial For Online Comments Claiming French President's Wife Is A Man
content: Ten people will go on trial on Monday over cyberbullying of Brigitte Macron after they allegedly made "malicious" comments online spreading claims that President Emmanuel Macron 's wife is a man.

title: Ukraine, Allies To Work On Ceasefire Plan In Next 10 Days: Zelensky
content: Ukraine and its allies agreed to work on a ceasefire plan in the coming ten days, President Volodymyr Zelensky said.

title: Trump Undergoes MRI Scan, His 2nd In A Year
content: US President Donald Trump said he had received an MRI scan during arecent hospital visit, providing an explanation for the first time for why he underwent a second medical exam in a year.

title: Afghanistan Urges "Understanding" As Pakistan Truce Talks Enter Third Day
content: Afghanistan and Pakistan entered a third day of negotiations Monday to secure a lasting ceasefire, with Kabul urging "dialogue and understanding" after Islamabad warned of war if talks collapse.

title: 4 Children Drown While Bathing In Ganges Ahead Of Chhath Puja In Bihar
content: Four children drowned in the Ganges on Monday morning while taking a bath ahead of the Chhath festival in Bihar's Bhagalpur district, police said.

title: Children Below 14 Banned From Working In Shops In Rajasthan
content: Chief Minister Bhajanlal Sharma has approved the Rajasthan Shops and Commercial Establishments (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025, which prohibits the employment of children aged below 14 years in shops and commercial establishments

title: "Twisting My Words": Priyank Kharge On Himanta Sarma Over Semiconductor Row
content: Congress leader and Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge on Monday launched a sharp counterattack against Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, accusing him and the BJP of deliberately misrepresenting his remarks about semiconductor investments.

title: Top Court Seeks Report On Vacancies As Plea Says Government 'Killing RTI'
content: The Supreme Court on Monday said that it will ensure full transparency in appointments to the Central and state information commissions.

title: Behind Pak's Civilian Facade, Asim Munir's Deep-State Consolidation Of Power
content: Asim Munir has already changed some top corps commanders to ensure that there would be no seniority issues.

title: Musk May Exit Tesla If $1 Trillion Pay Plan Rejected, Shareholders Warned
content: Elon Musk could leave Tesla as CEO if his proposed $1 trillion pay package was not approved, Chair Robyn Denholm warned in a letter to shareholders on Monday.

title: 800-Page Chargesheet Against Conman Harshvardhan Jain, Linked To Chandraswami
content: An 800-page chargesheet has been filed against Harshvardhan Jain, the alleged mastermind behind a fake embassy racket that duped businessmen across India.

title: 'Regret The Misunderstanding': Kangana Ranaut On Farmers Protests' Tweet
content: Actor-politician Kangana Ranaut on Monday appeared before a court here in a defamation case and said there was a "misunderstanding" about her 2021 tweet and that every 'mata' (mother) is respectable to her.

title: For Japan's Leader, Key To Connecting With Trump Could Be These Ford Trucks
content: President Donald Trump opened his visit to Japan on Monday with greetings from the emperor a day before he meets new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi, who is banking on building a friendly personal relationship with the US leader to ease trade tensions.

title: Female Patient Raped By Sanitation Worker At UP Hospital
content: A female patient was allegedly raped by a sanitation worker at a hospital here on Monday, police said.

title: Actor Vijay Meets Karur Stampede Victims' Families, Apologises To Them
content: Actor-politician Vijay on Monday met the families of the Karur stampede victims in Mahabalipuram near here and sought their forgiveness for the tragic incident that left 41 dead and over 60 injured.

title: MAGA wants Mamdani out: Zohran's US citizenship under scanner; 'anti-American' remarks draw ire
content: Prominent MAGA Republicans are demanding the DOJ investigate New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani, seeking to revoke his citizenship and deport him. They cite alleged undisclosed affiliations with the Democratic Socialists of America and past remarks.

title: Trump impact? Surge in India's crude import from US; why its moving away from Russia
content: India has significantly increased its crude oil imports from the US, reaching 540,000 barrels per day in October. This move aims to diversify oil sources beyond Russia and address trade concerns with the Trump administration, while also navigating new sanctions on Russian oil giants.

title: Racial hate crime: Indian-origin woman raped in UK; 32-yr-old ‘white male’ held
content: A 32-year-old man was arrested following a manhunt after an alleged racially aggravated rape of a 20-year-old Indian-origin woman in Walsall. Police are treating the attack as racially motivated and are providing full support to the victim. The incident has sparked outrage and calls for justice from community leaders and MPs.

title: AB de Villiers explodes: 'Cockroaches crawl out to attack' — defends Rohit & Kohli
content: Former cricketer AB de Villiers has strongly defended Indian stars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. He criticized those spreading negativity about the players. De Villiers stated that both cricketers deserve celebration for their contributions. Kohli and Sharma recently silenced critics with strong performances in an ODI series against Australia. Their efforts secured a significant win for India.

title: Father gets IT notice for selling ancestral land jointly with son - how he won case
content: A father-son duo faced tax issues after jointly selling ancestral land. The purchaser erroneously deducted the entire TDS under the father's name, leading to a notice. The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) Pune ultimately ruled in the father's favor, stating the revenue cannot be unjustly enriched by the deductor's error.

title: TCS issues clarification: Don’t provide cybersecurity services to M&S
content: TCS has denied reports claiming Marks & Spencer terminated their contract following a £300 million cyberattack. The IT firm stated the report contained factual inaccuracies and that it does not provide cybersecurity services to M&S. TCS clarified that their service desk contract with M&S concluded prior to the April 2025 cyber incident through a competitive RFP process.

title: 'Govt chooses voters': Oppn takes shot at SIR 2.0; who said what
content: Opposition leaders have fiercely criticized the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, alleging it's a 'vote theft' tactic to favor the BJP. Accusations of government pressure and manipulation of voter lists have surfaced, with concerns raised about the transparency and fairness of the process, particularly following similar exercises in Bihar.

title: Women’s World Cup: Shafali Verma returns; replaces injured Pratika Rawal
content: Shafali Verma replaces Pratika Rawal in India's Women's ODI World Cup 2025 squad due to Rawal's knee and ankle injuries. Rawal's absence is a significant blow, having been a consistent performer with 308 runs. Verma's aggressive batting style and strong domestic form offer India a renewed spark at the top as they face Australia in the semi-final.

title: World’s first AI minister: 'Diella' to give birth to 83 ‘AI children’
content: Albania's Prime Minister Edi Rama announced their AI minister, Diella, is 'pregnant' with 83 digital 'offspring.' These AI assistants will aid Socialist Party MPs, enhancing parliamentary efficiency and transparency. Diella, the world's first AI minister, was appointed to combat corruption in government tenders, marking a significant step in integrating AI into governance.

title: Ranji Trophy: Fastest! Prithvi Shaw sets 21st-century record with rare batting feat
content: Prithvi Shaw has etched his name in Ranji Trophy history by scoring the fastest double century in the 21st century, reaching the milestone in just 141 balls. This remarkable innings of 222 runs against Chandigarh places him alongside legends like Ravi Shastri and Virender Sehwag for his rapid scoring prowess in first-class cricket.

title: Is LeBron James playing tonight vs Trail Blazers? Lakers star injury update
content: LeBron James is sidelined for the Los Angeles Lakers' October 27, 2025 game against the Portland Trail Blazers due to a persistent sciatic nerve injury. The 40-year-old superstar's absence creates a significant void, impacting the team's leadership and versatility as they face a tough matchup.  His return is tentatively eyed for early November, pending smooth rehabilitation.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Ghee & wine: Inside Delhi woman's 'fiery' plot to kill boyfriend; what was the motive?
content: A live-in relationship turned deadly as a 21-year-old woman, her ex-boyfriend, and his friend allegedly murdered her partner, a UPSC aspirant, in Delhi. They staged the crime as a fire incident to conceal the murder, driven by the victim's alleged possession of objectionable content. The trio has been arrested.

title: Joe Alwyn slammed as old video with Taylor Swift goes viral amid Kelce praise
content: Taylor Swift's upcoming wedding to Travis Kelce has fans buzzing, especially after a resurfaced clip from 2022 showing her with ex Joe Alwyn sparked outrage.  Fans criticized Alwyn's apparent rush to avoid paparazzi, contrasting it with Kelce's public support for Swift's success.  The couple remains private about their wedding details.

title: Is Jayden Daniels playing tonight vs Chiefs? Washington QB injury update
content: Jayden Daniels, the Commanders' dynamic quarterback, is sidelined tonight against the Chiefs due to a hamstring injury sustained last week. This setback follows a previous knee issue. Veteran Marcus Mariota will start, with Washington targeting Week 9 for Daniels' potential return. Keeping their young star healthy is crucial for the team's season.

title: Lauren Kyle McDavid shapes Edmonton’s design and lifestyle culture
content: While the Oilers faced a Stanley Cup Final loss, Lauren Kyle McDavid is forging her own path in Edmonton. Her innovative Trove Living concept, blending furniture, design, and a social hub, has become a vibrant downtown destination.  Her fashion brand and community involvement further solidify her commitment to the city, mirroring Connor's ambition.

title: Big relief: H-4 visa holders keep right to work in US - will Trump change it?
content: The US Supreme Court has ended a decade-long legal fight, allowing H-4 visa holders, primarily spouses of H-1B workers, to continue working. This decision upholds employment authorization for those facing green card backlogs.

title: Pakistan head coach adds pressure on Babar Azam ahead of T20I comeback
content: Babar Azam is set to return to Pakistan's T20I side at number three against South Africa, his first appearance in the format since December 2024. This strategic move follows Fakhar Zaman's break to focus on domestic cricket. Azam, with an impressive T20I record, is expected to bolster the top order.

title: Bihar elections 2025: 56 days & counting - where is Rahul Gandhi?
content: Rahul Gandhi's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar has lost momentum, with his absence dominating the election narrative. While other leaders campaign intensely, Gandhi's delayed re-entry, just before polling, raises questions about his impact and the Congress party's strategy in the state.

title: ‘Never do a PhD if you’re not…’: Google-trained AI founder’s blunt advice to students
content: Jad Tarifi, founder of Integral AI and former Google AI team member, warns that PhDs may no longer guarantee relevance in the fast-moving AI era. He argues that multi-year degrees risk obsolescence before completion and should only be pursued by those genuinely obsessed with their field. Instead, he advocates learning from life, developing emotional intelligence, and embracing adaptability. Tarifi suggests that passion, not credentials, is the key to staying ahead in a world where technology evolves rapidly.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Stop!' India selectors given warning on Rohit and Virat selection
content: Former captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth urged the BCCI selectors to back Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for the 2027 World Cup, emphasizing their fitness and recent performances. He advised clear communication, assuring the veterans of their importance and encouraging them to focus on staying fit to lead India to victory.

title: No SIR in Assam? Electoral rolls to be announced separately; EC explains why
content: The Election Commission will conduct a separate Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Assam due to unique legal provisions. Meanwhile, the second phase of SIR will cover 12 states and UTs, aiming to ensure accurate voter lists before upcoming polls.

title: 'Flying Chernobyl': Russia now has nuclear-powered missile; what is Burevestnik?
content: Russia successfully tested its nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile, a weapon President Putin claims can "pierce any defence shield." The test, conducted alongside a nuclear drill, signals Moscow's defiance against Western pressure over Ukraine. Putin announced the country will now move towards deploying the "invincible" missile, which reportedly traveled 14,000 kilometers.

title: Surya’s form a concern? Gambhir breaks silence: 'We’ve made a decision'
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir backs T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav despite recent batting dips, emphasizing an ultra-aggressive team philosophy where failures are accepted. Gambhir prioritizes a fearless brand of cricket over individual scores, highlighting Suryakumar's leadership and a dressing room culture built on trust and freedom from the fear of losing.

title: Why is Joel Embiid out vs Orlando Magic? Latest update on 76ers star’s injury
content: Joel Embiid will sit out Monday's game against the Orlando Magic due to "injury management" for his left knee, a decision made to avoid risks on a back-to-back.  His playing time has been limited this season, and he expressed frustration with the short stints. Four other Sixers players are also sidelined with various injuries.

title: Whose gold is it? Wife’s Rs 1.65cr jewellery seized; husband moves ITAT & wins - explained
content: The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal ruled in favor of a taxpayer, stating that gold jewelry seized during a search could not be treated as unexplained investment in his hands. The Tribunal noted that the same assets were already declared and accepted in his wife's tax assessment, making a separate addition legally baseless.

title: UP's Mustafabad to be renamed? What CM Yogi said
content: In a move to honor cultural heritage, Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath declared the renaming of Mustafabad village in Lakhimpur Kheri to 'Kabirdham'. This decision seeks to revive the legacy of Sant Kabir, particularly underscoring the village's historical significance regardless of its current demographics. Adityanath's announcement aligns with other similar renaming efforts aimed at restoring the region's cultural roots.

title: Hack of the day: Flight delayed or cancelled? Get refund or compensation
content: Stranded due to flight disruptions in India? You're entitled to rights! Airlines must provide meals, refreshments, and even hotel stays for significant delays. For cancellations, expect refunds or rebooking options. Know your entitlements under the Passenger Charter and how to file a complaint via AirSewa to claim compensation up to ₹10,000.

title: Asia Cup handshake row: J&K CM bats for 'spirit of the game' - 'why not?'
content: Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah expressed disappointment that the Indian cricket team did not shake hands with Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha's side during the Asia Cup. He emphasized playing in the spirit of the game and advocated for resuming bilateral cricket ties between the two nations.

title: Gainfully 'employed': Rajasthan Officer ‘pays salaries’ to wife for fake jobs
content: Jaipur's anti-corruption bureau has filed a case against a senior IT department officer, Pradhyuman Dixit, for allegedly orchestrating illegal salary payments to his wife, Poonam Dixit, through two private firms. Over Rs 30 lakh was deposited into her accounts between 2019 and 2020, despite her never working for the companies. Authorities suspect these payments were bribes for IT contract favors.

title: Shreyas Iyer still in ICU after dangerously low body vitals, internal bleeding
content: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is currently in the ICU of a Sydney hospital following a serious fall during the third ODI against Australia. Reports indicate he experienced dangerously low body vitals post-incident and was immediately hospitalized in a critical, life-threatening condition. His recovery is ongoing.

title: Major update on Tom Aspinall following shocking eye poke spot at UFC 321
content: UFC 321's main event concluded controversially when Tom Aspinall was accidentally eye-poked by Ciryl Gane, rendering him unable to continue. Aspinall later shared an update, expressing significant concern about his eye injury, stating it's scarier than his previous knee injury. He has returned to England for further medical evaluation.

title: 'Attack' on CJI: Why SC refused to act against accused lawyer; will set up norms
content: The Supreme Court acknowledged shoe-hurling as contempt but declined action against the lawyer, citing potential glorification. The SCBA president criticized this, deeming it a joke on the institution. The apex court will instead issue guidelines on social media conduct and the glorification of such incidents.

title: iPhones boom, Trump sanctions impact: Electronics to become 2nd-most exported
content: India's electronics exports are surging, driven by booming iPhone production, and are projected to become the second-largest export category. This rise coincides with a potential decline in oil exports due to US sanctions on Russian crude, impacting refiners' purchases and eliminating price advantages.

title: Kolkata: Mob of 50 led by auto driver storms flat, assaults customs officer, wife
content: A customs inspector and his wife were brutally assaulted in their Kolkata home by a mob of 50, led by an auto driver, after a minor traffic altercation. Police, reportedly busy with Kali Puja immersions, arrived late, allowing most attackers to escape. Arrested individuals were quickly granted bail, sparking resident fears.

title: 'No one can compete with us': Tej Pratap says Mahua backing JJD; vows to work for Bihar
content: Janshakti Janata Dal (JJD) chief Tej Pratap Yadav expressed strong confidence ahead of the Bihar elections, asserting massive support in his Mahua constituency and claiming no one can compete with his party. He emphasized that voters will decide the next government and highlighted his party's agenda of development and public welfare.

title: Gold rate today below Rs 1.23 lakh per 10 grams. what’s the outlook?
content: Gold and silver prices saw a dip in early trading as investors booked profits after a recent rally and market fluctuations. Geopolitical tensions and upcoming US Fed policy meeting influenced traders to reduce positions at higher price points. Investors are now awaiting key US CPI data for further market direction.

title: UP highway horror: Sleeper bus gutted on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
content: A Delhi-Gonda sleeper bus caught fire early Sunday on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway. Driver Jagat Singh and aides Shyam Sundar and Manish swiftly evacuated all 39 passengers. Their quick thinking and brave actions prevented any loss of life. The bus was completely gutted before fire services arrived. Passengers praised the trio's courage.

title: Odisha deploys disaster response forces to tackle Cyclone Montha
content: All district administrations have been asked to ensure ‘zero casualty’ in the natural disaster, said Suresh Pujari, State Revenue and Disaster Management Minister

title: Chetan and Ajit carry family legacies into Bihar battle
content: Two candidates from the Rajput community have distinct profiles – while one is battling the legacy of a ‘don’, the other is following the footsteps of a man who has never compromised on his ideology

title: Cyclone Montha triggers heavy rainfall in Andhra’s Visakhapatnam, Anakapalli and Srikakulam districts
content: Cyclonic storm Montha is very likely to cross Andhra Pradesh coast between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam around Kakinada in the evening or night of Oct.28 as a severe cyclonic storm with a maximum sustained wind speed of 90-100 kmph, says IMD; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to ensure that relief reaches the public without delay

title: Voters in rural Bihar still reluctant to rally behind ‘untested’ Jan Suraaj
content: From distrust to disinterest, JSP struggles with low recall and credibility in the State’s hinterlands. However, urban voters who have grievances with the current government but are uncomfortable voting for the Tejashwi Yadav-led Grand Alliance, do see Prashant Kishor’s party as an alternative

title: Black hole activities suppress the birth of new stars around it: Study
content: ‘It reveals that both intense radiation from around the black holes as well as the high-speed jets they emit can work together to eject gas from the centres of galaxies, potentially shutting down star formation in their central regions and regulating galactic growth.

title: T.N. will fight any attempt to disenfranchise its people, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: DMK and its allies have called for an all-party meeting on the SIR of electoral rolls on November 2. The leaders alleged that the functioning of the EC was not only controversial but also suspicious

title: Digital arrest is one of the most dreaded threats to citizens: President Murmu
content: Addressing Indian Police Service probationers, the President referred to the growing trend of fraudsters impersonating law enforcement officers, and extorting money by threatening victims with arrest or the freezing of bank accounts

title: Election Commission modifies some SIR rules after Bihar
content: No documents are to be collected from electors during the Enumeration Phase, the ECI said in a notice issued to the Chief Electoral Officers of the 12 States and Union Territories where the SIR will be carried out next

title: Navy’s top maritime forum, the Indo-Pacific Regional Dialogue 2025, opens today
content: The IPRD 2025 aims to strengthen multilateral cooperation, promote regional stability, and advance the shared vision of a resilient and prosperous Indo-Pacific

title: Japanese PM Takaichi faces her first big diplomatic test with Trump talks
content: The meeting will be watched closely in Delhi for any clarity between the two leaders on India’s plans to host the delayed Quad summit; the visit to Japan comes just before Trump’s meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea

title: Well-prepared for SIR in Kerala, says Kelkar
content: Steps being taken to avoid ‘dual duty’ trouble for officers as SIR coincides with 2025 local body polls, says Rathan Kelkar

title: Chief Information Commissioner appointments in 'two or three' weeks, Centre tells SC
content: “The best way to kill the RTI is to not make any appointments… If they do make appointments, they select persons out of the blue. Names are just air-dropped. There is no information on who is being appointed,” said Prashant Bhushan.

title: SC raps Delhi police for delay in filing response to bail pleas of 2020 riots accused
content: The top court said most of the accused in the larger 2020 Delhi riots conspiracy case have already spent nearly five years in custody

title: IRCTC scam case: Lalu Yadav, Rabri Devi ask Delhi court not to conduct day-to-day trial
content: Say day-to-day hearings are happening in three other cases and ask for time to read the chargesheet and court order

title: CM okays land for railway coaching terminals at Amaravati, Gannavaram
content: Chandrababu Naidu orders immediate release of ₹27 crore for next phase of work on new Nadikudi-Srikalahasti railway line, moots Integrated Logistics Park, high-speed elevated railway corridors on Hyderabad-Bengaluru and Hyderabad-Chennai routes via Amaravati

title: Fill vacant posts in agricultural institutes, Chouhan tells ICAR, States
content: The Union Minister stressed the need to develop agriculture-related educational infrastructure and enable self-reliance

title: Three-day national conference of school boards in Hyderabad from Oct. 29
content: Delegates ranging from chairpersons of school boards and policy experts, to representatives from international affiliates such as Cambridge and the International Baccalaureate (IB) will be present to share knowledge on assessment reforms, quality assurance, skill education and digital learning ecosystems

title: Willing to work, even without pay, during monsoon, protesting conservancy workers tell Madras High Court
content: They say they are making the unconditional and voluntary offer as a gesture of goodwill and in the interest of the residents of Chennai

title: Great Nicobar Island Project: over 70 experts, scientists write to Environment Minister on ‘grave’, irreversible’ impact
content: The letter, made public and sent to Bhupender Yadav’s office as well, was in response to the Environment Minister’s article in The Hindu last month, in which he defended the project

title: CCB busts international cybercrime racket, arrests two
content: The accused had hacked into the accounts of a private firm and transferred ₹47 crore within two and a half hours on October 6

title: Omar Abdullah calls out cross-voters, ‘destruction of votes’ in J&K Rajya Sabha election
content: The issue of cross-voting gripped the J&K Assembly on Monday as members of the ruling alliance raised slogans of ‘vote chori’ (stealing)

title: 47 schools in Kerala had zero students in 2024-25: Union Ministry data
content: These schools also had 19 teachers to teach students. None of these schools are in the government sector, clarifies Samagra Shiksha Kerala

title: Srisailam wears festive look on first Monday of ’Karthika Masam’
content: The temple pond, Pushkarini, was lit up with 1 lakh lamps as part of ’Laksha Deepotsavam’, while ‘Pushkarini Harathi’ was performed on the occasion

title: Cricket fever grips Karimnagar as district hosts first official HCA league matches
content: Karimnagar earned the unique distinction of being the first district in Telangana to host the official A-Level HCA League matches outside Hyderabad

title: Shadow of Sabarimala looms large as Pandalam prepares for another poll battle
content: BJP, seeking a second straight term, exudes confidence.  Determined to widen its successful strategy of combining Hindu and Christian voters and stamp Pandalam as a ‘saffron fort,’ the party has already completed groundwork.  Riding on council’s administrative lapses, LDF plans to corner BJP over its governance record. UDF is also attempting a comeback attempt, riding on the  Sabarimala sentiment. Its “faith protection marches” culminated in a grand show of strength here

title: Hospital retrieves man’s body from home after it forgets to do autopsy
content: Hospital officials say they forgot to conduct post-mortem examination thinking that it was a natural death as he died after a month’s treatment

title: Tenant farmers reel under steep lease rates, lack of support in Andhra Pradesh: survey
content: A.P. Tenant Farmers’ Union study across all 26 districts finds most cultivators landless, uninsured, and excluded from crop registration and credit access

title: Karnataka coffee growers welcome Modi’s praise, seek action on long-pending challenges
content: In his monthly radio broadcast, Modi lauded the distinctive character and diversity of Indian coffee, saying it has carved a ‘unique identity’ on the world stage

title: Punnapra-Vayalar uprising served as inspiration for future struggles: Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurates the valedictory function of  anniversary of the Punnapra-Vayalar uprising at Vayalar.

title: Chief Secretary directs power utilities to stay on high alert for Cyclone Montha
content: Vijayanand reviews readiness of Genco, Transco and DISCOMs; calls for seamless coordination and quick power restoration in coastal areas

title: Great Nicobar project will boost India’s maritime global trade, says Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah outlines plans for shipping sector at India Maritime Week; 680 MoUs worth ₹10 lakh crore likely to be signed

title: Delhi to bar entry of non-BS-VI compliant vehicles registered outside city from Nov. 1
content: Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) approved a sweeping ban on the entry of polluting commercial vehicles into Delhi from November 1, amid the city's pollution woes.

title: Naidu orders coastal evacuations, vows zero casualties as Cyclone Montha nears
content: State government steps up preparedness with real-time monitoring, relief centres, and preventive measures in vulnerable regions under the Chief Minister’s directives

title: BJP leadership seeks explanation from Palakkad municipal chairperson
content: Rift within BJP comes to the fore as a section turns against Prameela Sasidharan for attending function attended by Rahul Mamkootathil

title: Cyclone Montha: Nandyal and Kurnool administration put on alert
content: Nandyal Collector asks farmers to take necessary precautions to avoid crop losses as there is a possibility of the district bearing the impact of the cyclone

title: Bihar Assembly polls: CPI(ML) candidate is fighting ‘big money’ with small donations
content: CPI(ML)’s Arrah candidate Quyamuddin Ansari says wherever he goes, he spreads a “towel in front of the people, and they contribute”, he is confident that this time the people will throw the NDA out of power

title: Rajasthan bars children below 14 from working in shops, commercial establishments
content: The State also approved amendments to the Rajasthan Factories (Amendment) Rules, 2025, aimed at promoting business activities while ensuring the welfare and safety of workers, according to a statement

title: Seethathodu-Nilackal drinking water project commissioned ahead of Sabarimala season
content: Implemented at a cost of ₹84.38 crore, the project aims to provide round-the-clock access to safe drinking water for the lakhs of pilgrims visiting Nilackal every season

title: SAAP Chairman slams YSRCP, Sakshi media for spreading false propoganda
content: After the probe over the irregularities in the liquor scam is completed, the coalition government will  take action against those involved in the Aadudam Andhra scandal, says Ravi Naidu

title: Why the rush for SIR in other States, ask Opposition parties
content: Opposition questions EC’s move when Supreme Court is looking into Bihar SIR; Parties fear legitimate voters will be removed from rolls; Kerala Assembly passes resolution against exercise

title: GHMC to penalise the high absenteeism among sanitation workers
content: High absenteeism among the sanitation workers in the city is affecting the road sweeping services adversely, officials say, justifying the penal action

title: CBI books Aligarh man who was running ‘Centre for Narendra Modi Studies’
content: Lawyer Jasim Mohammad was running the centre without permission, in violation of the Emblems and Names (Prevention of Improper Use) Act

title: Friends are not crutches, clarifies Fadnavis after Shah's statement
content: Criticising the Opposition for raising doubts over the electoral rolls, Mr. Fadnavis said, “I have already said that it is cover firing ahead of an impending defeat.”

title: Haste in signing PM SHRI pact hints at ulterior motives, says Venugopal
content: Congress leader accuses LDF government of neglecting the interests of the State’s government employees

title: HC orders CID probe into theft of money offered to Tirumala temple
content: The probe should also include the role of TTD Trust Board, its officers, and the de facto complainant, and it should be completed by December 2, orders a single–judge Bench

title: Assam excluded from SIR States list: CEC says special orders to be issued separately
content: Assam did not figure in the list of 12 states and Union Territories where the electoral roll clean-up exercise has been announced from November 4.

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 9: Vandy's in the field!
content: Vanderbilt Commodores is on the brink of making its first appearance in any CFP ranking during the playoff era . if the playoff were today, they would already be in the top 12 when the first ranking is released Nov. 4 . there's a chance to make their debut in the coveted top 12 .

title: Week 9 Power Rankings: Top 5 stays consistent; Houston and Utah join the list
content: Ole Miss' road win against Oklahoma makes the Rebels a virtual lock for the playoff . deion Sanders summed it up after watching his team give up 587 yards of offense in a 53-7 loss to Utah . "this is probably the worst beating I've ever had except when my momma whooped me as a kid," Sanders said .

title: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: the case focused on rigged poker games is one of two announced that allegedly involve prominent NBA figures . investigators state that the scheme began in April 2019 when defendant Robert "Black Rob" Stroud and other co-conspirators devised a ruse to use technology to rig illegal poker games against unwitting, wealthy players . in many cases, every other person at the poker table at the same time believed these were "straight" games against other wealthy players.

title: Ranking 80 men's NCAA basketball teams by March Madness potential
content: some of the following teams will be in a different tier by the end of 2025-26 . there are also teams with second-weekend potential that could fall to the bubble . auburn has lost a lot of talent and a head coach .

title: Dick Vitale's teams, storylines to watch
content: this season is gonna be Awesome, with a capital A! college hoops fans, get ready -- your favorite time of year is back . I'm talking about buzzer-beaters, Diaper Dandies and Prime Time Players (PTPers) lighting up the court .

title: Rink report: The most intriguing Frozen Frenzy matchups to watch
content: all 32 teams are in action on the "Hockey Christmas" day . the night includes a tripleheader on ESPN . a red zone-style whip-around show hosted by John Buccigross and Kevin Weekes .

title: How the matchups line up for all 46 postseason games
content: all four of those teams are in the mix for the college football Playoff . the five highest-ranked conference champions, plus the next seven highest-rated teams, will make the field . last season's inaugural 12-team CFP, the five most-ranked conferences champions will be awarded first-round byes .

title: ⁠Fantasy hockey pickups: Plan for Frozen Frenzy with Blues and Blue Jackets
content: we'll mine the waiver wire for lesser-rostered performers who have the potential to help fantasy teams in a variety of leagues . Tuesday's Frozen Frenzy headlines the schedule with 16 games -- with one starting every 15 minutes beginning at 6 p.m. ET . Thursday and Saturday also deliver heavy slates with 11 and 13 games .

title: VAR review: Was Sunderland's goal offside? Did Gakpo deserve a penalty?
content: Janusz Michallik reacts to sunderland's 2-1 defeat in the premier league . the video assistant referee causes controversy every week in the Premier League . we take a look at the major incidents to examine and explain the process in terms of the VAR protocol and the Laws of the Game .
